content: coffee cup cozy sampler set 4 designs by amy drossner copyright © april 2022 this is a set of 4 beautiful cup cozies for you to wrap your hot coffee or tea in lovely texture and eye-pleasing stitch designs made with comfortable cotton in a variety of beautiful colors these are an ideal alternative to paper cup sleeves as they are reusable easy to keep with you in a bag or in the car and easy to wash if needed each of these cozies can be completed in under an hour with less than 40 yards of cotton yarn making them easy affordable and a great way to use up any partial skeins of yarn the kaffee the tresa the droma the valuri the coffee cup cozy sampler set by amy drossner copyright © may 2022 1 pattern notes ● these cozies will fit standard sized convenience store-type paper coffee cups if your initial chain meets the stated length ● all of these cozies start with a foundation chain row - either single_crochet foundation or half_double_crochet foundation if you aren t sure about foundation starting row there are many helpful tutorials and videos available being that the starting row here are relatively short in length 7 ¾-8 this is a great project to learn and get comfortable with foundation starting row ● note all of these cozies can be very easily adjusted to be larger or smaller simply add or subtract a multiple of 2 to the foundation chain and proceed with the instructions using your total multiple of 2 as the total number of stitches per round ● the chain 1 at the beginning of each round never counts as a stitch hook sizes g/4 25 mm h/5 mm hobby lobby i love this cotton worsted weight 4 yarn needle scissors optional stitch marker stitches used in all cozies foundation single_crochet hbdc - herringbone double_crochet foundation half_double_crochet fpsc - front post single_crochet single_crochet - single_crochet fphdc - front post half_double_crochet half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet fpdc - front post double_crochet double_crochet - double_crochet flo - front loop only single_crochet 3lo - single_crochet in 3rd loop only blo -back loop only half_double_crochet 3lo - half_double_crochet in 3rd loop only slip_stitch - slip_stitch back vertical bar only explanation and photo in the pattern invj invisible join ❖ i really dislike the visible noticeable seam that results from slip stitching row closed so i always join row with an invisible join - never a slip_stitch ➢ when you get to the last stitch of the row and you are ready to join drop the loop on your hook insert the hook from back to front into both loops of the the joining stitch which will be the first stitch of every round pick up the working loop and pull it through this will create an invisible seam don t pull it through tightly - this is the first stitch of the next round you don t want it to disappear for pulling through too
